fixes.title: Hero section buries the lead
fixes.problem: "An AI assistant that actually knows your work" is generic. Every AI product says this. The actual differentiator is radical simplicity: forward an email and get work back.
fixes.action: Lead with the mechanism, not the promise.

current_copy.headline: An AI assistant that actually knows your work.
current_copy.subheadline: Workpal learns your skills, your role, your deliverables. Forward it any task from your inbox — it does the work and replies only to you. No one else can access it. Ever.

suggested_copy.headline: Forward an email. Get the work done.
suggested_copy.subheadline: No app to install. No prompt to write. Just forward any task to your AI operator — it does the work and emails you back.

fixes.title: No social proof anywhere
fixes.problem: Zero testimonials, zero user counts, zero logos. Without social proof, "Free forever" feels like a trap, not generosity.
fixes.action: Add trust signals immediately below the hero CTA.

suggested_elements.note: Use real number if available; even "Trusted by early adopters at" + logo row works

placeholder_examples.quote: I forwarded a 40-page RFP at midnight and had a draft response by morning. My client thought I pulled an all-nighter.
placeholder_examples.name: Priya M.

placeholder_examples.quote: My sales team went from 0% AI adoption to 100% in one day. No training needed.
placeholder_examples.name: James T.

placeholder_examples.quote: I stopped copying emails into ChatGPT. This is just... how it should work.
placeholder_examples.name: Sarah K.

suggested_elements.note: Show logos of companies where beta users work. Even 4-5 greyscale logos add credibility.

fixes.title: 3-step email sequence is good but static
fixes.problem: The boss@client.com scenario is the strongest conversion asset but it's just text. Needs to feel alive.
fixes.action: Make the email thread interactive or animated.

suggested_implementations.description: Scrolling email thread that plays out in real time — boss email slides in, forward animation, processing dots, then reply appears with a typing effect.
Move the Loom video embed directly into this section instead of a separate "Watch how Workpal works" section below.
Let user click "Forward" button on the mock email to trigger the reply animation. Micro-interaction builds muscle memory for the real product.

fixes.title: "Free forever" creates wrong expectations
fixes.problem: Signals either (a) product isn't valuable enough to charge for, or (b) promise will eventually change. Anchors to an unsustainable commitment.
fixes.current_copy: Free forever for individuals. No credit card. No new apps to learn.
fixes.suggested_copy: Free to start. No credit card. No new apps to learn.
fixes.note: Preserves low-friction signup without anchoring to a promise you may not keep.

fixes.title: CTA is too abstract
fixes.problem: "Get My Workpal" doesn't match the actual user action (pasting LinkedIn URL + email). Every click before value delivery reduces conversion.
fixes.action: Replace button CTA with an inline signup form in the hero section.

suggested_cta.headline: Paste your LinkedIn — get your AI operator in 60 seconds
suggested_cta.below_text: Free to start. No credit card required.

fixes.title: ChatGPT comparison needs visual before/after, not feature table
fixes.problem: Bullet-point feature tables don't create emotional contrast. Need to show the same task done both ways.
fixes.action: Replace feature checklist with side-by-side task walkthrough.

suggested_layout.task: Boss sends: "Summarize these 3 vendor proposals and recommend one."

left_panel.label: ChatGPT / Claude
steps: Write a detailed prompt explaining what you need
Copy output back into email, reformat

right_panel.label: WorkPal
steps: Get structured analysis back in your inbox

fixes.title: Missing use case specificity
fixes.problem: Page says "Sales, ops, legal, HR, finance" but doesn't show what WorkPal produces for each. Specificity sells, generality doesn't.
fixes.action: Add 4 concrete use case cards with real-ish output previews.

suggested_use_cases.trigger: Client forwards: "Analyze these 10 competitor decks and brief me by morning."
suggested_use_cases.workpal_output_preview: Competitive landscape matrix with positioning gaps, pricing comparison table, and 3 strategic recommendations — delivered as a formatted email with attached summary deck.

suggested_use_cases.trigger: Prospect replies: "Sounds interesting, but how does this compare to [competitor]?"
suggested_use_cases.workpal_output_preview: Personalized competitive comparison email addressing the prospect's specific use case, with objection handling and a soft close for a demo call.

suggested_use_cases.trigger: Partner forwards: "Review this contract redline and flag any issues."
suggested_use_cases.workpal_output_preview: Clause-by-clause risk assessment highlighting 7 flagged provisions with recommended negotiation positions and precedent references.

suggested_use_cases.trigger: Hiring manager sends: "Write a job description for this new role based on the attached org chart."
suggested_use_cases.workpal_output_preview: Complete JD with role summary, qualifications, responsibilities, and compensation band suggestion — formatted and ready to post.

fixes.title: No urgency or scarcity
fixes.problem: No reason to sign up today vs next month.
fixes.action: Add at least one urgency mechanism.

suggested_options.copy: Early access — limited to first 1,000 users
suggested_options.implementation: Show a progress bar or counter

suggested_options.copy: Join 847 professionals who signed up this week
First 1,000 users get lifetime Pro features — free
suggested_options.implementation: Badge or tag on early accounts

fixes.title: Add a "Try without signing up" option
fixes.problem: Users must fully sign up before experiencing any value. Trust barrier kills conversion.
fixes.action: Add a working demo input on the landing page.

suggested_implementation.headline: Try it right now — no signup needed
suggested_implementation.subheadline: Paste any email text below and see what WorkPal would send back.

fields.name: email_body
fields.placeholder: Paste an email you'd normally forward to a colleague or assistant...

suggested_implementation.output_display: Render the AI response in a mock email thread UI, then CTA: "Like what you see? Get your own WorkPal in 60 seconds."
suggested_implementation.conversion_note: This alone could 5x conversion rate. Removes the trust barrier completely.
